Key Match Events: Spain defeated Germany 2-1 in the Euro 2024 quarter-final on July 5, 2024.
Dani Olmo scored for Spain in the 51st minute.
Mikel Merino scored the winning goal for Spain in the 119th minute.
Florian Wirtz scored for Germany in the 89th minute.
Antonio Rudiger, David Raum, Robert Andrich, Toni Kroos, Maximilian Mittelstadt, Nico Schlotterbeck, Florian Wirtz, and Deniz Undav received yellow cards for Germany.
Robin Le Normand, Pau Torres, Unai Simon, Dani Carvajal, Rodri, and Fabian Ruiz received yellow cards for Spain.
Dani Carvajal received a red card in the 120+6th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany midfielder Toni Kroos praised Spain's Rodri and Lamine Yamal ahead of the match.
Germany's Joshua Kimmich mentioned that Spain had been the most impressive side in the tournament so far.
Kroos highlighted Rodri's ability to remain calm under pressure and his recent important goals.
Kroos noted Yamal's exceptional talent at a young age and his impact for Barcelona.
